Package shapeSupport

Class Sorting

java.lang.Object
shapeSupport.Sorting
public final class Sorting extends Object
Classes for bubbleSort, selectionSort, insertionSort, mergeSort, quickSort, and shellSort.
Author:
Diego Maia, Dakota Chatt, Matthew Jacyk, Kevin Ung

    • bubbleSort

      public static <T> void bubbleSort(Comparable<T>[] array, String comp) throws SecurityException, IllegalAccessException, IllegalArgumentException, InvocationTargetException
      Bubble sort method traverses from first to last element, if current element is smaller than next element, it is swapped.
      Type Parameters:
      T - This describes the array type.
      Parameters:
      array - This is the array being compared.
      comp - Integer as a result of comparison of Area, Volume or Height between two elements of the array.
      Throws:
      IllegalAccessException - Thrown when application tries to reflectively create an instance, or set/get a field in a class.
      SecurityException
      IllegalArgumentException
      InvocationTargetException

    • merge

      private static <T> void merge(Comparable<T>[] array, String comp, int start, int mid, int end) throws SecurityException, IllegalAccessException, IllegalArgumentException, InvocationTargetException
      merge method determines the length of array and splits it into sub-arrays to be compared and merged together in a sorted array in Merge Sort method.
      Type Parameters:
      T - This describes the array type.
      Parameters:
      array - This is the array being compared.
      comp - Integer as a result of comparison of Area, Volume or Height between two elements of the array.
      start - Represents the index at the beginning of array.
      mid - Represents the index at the middle of array.
      end - Represents the index at the ending of array.
      Throws:
      IllegalAccessException - Thrown when application tries to reflectively create an instance, or set/get a field in a class.
      SecurityException
      IllegalArgumentException
      InvocationTargetException

    • shellSort

      public static <T> void shellSort(Comparable<T>[] array, String comp)
      Shell Sort It's a variation of Insert Sort, but in this type of sorting should be started comparing extremes of a pivot point (length/2) and swap the elements. This sorting is always reducing by half as a base of comparison, as the lowest level remaning one element must be sorted and, in this case, similar of Insert Sort, with previous levels already sorted. Time performance: Worst case O(n^2), average case O(n log n)
      Type Parameters:
      T - This describes the array type.
      Parameters:
      array - Array must be sorted
      comp - Integer as a result of comparison of Area, Volume or Height between two elements of the array
      Throws:
      SecurityException
      IllegalAccessException - Thrown when application tries to reflectively create an instance, or set/get a field in a class.
      IllegalArgumentException
      InvocationTargetException

    • swap

      private static <T> void swap(Comparable<T>[] array, int i, int j)
      Swap method which swaps the index positions of int i and j.
      Type Parameters:
      T - This describes the array type.
      Parameters:
      array - This is the array being compared.
      i - Element to be swapped with index of j.
      j - Element to be swapped with index of i.

    • comparison

      private static <T> int comparison(String comp, Comparable<T> array, Comparable<T> temp)
      Comparison method casts shape object into a comparable array and temp to calculate the shapes base area, volume, and height.
      Type Parameters:
      T - This describes the array type.
      Parameters:
      comp - Integer as a result of comparison of Area, Volume or Height between two elements of the array.
      array - This is the array being compared.
      temp - Temporary array to be compared with original array.
      Returns:
      returns the result of compared base area, volume, and height of shapes.
